a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Major hurricanes are defined as those of category 3, 4 or 5 on the Saffirâ€“Simpson hurricane wind scale (SSHWS).
The SSHWS classifies storms based on the intensity of sustained winds. Major hurricanes have potential for
significant loss of life and damage.

g.text: Major North Atlantic hurricanesMajor North Atlantic hurricanes

text.tspan: Data source: HURDAT, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (2024)
Note: NOAA notes that data prior to 1900 may not be complete for all US states.
